Light Armor Set.descricao: Armor Sets focus on aesthetics rather than set bonuses, allowing for more freedom in Build variety, while the weight of an Armor Set plays a crucial role in determining the effectiveness of evasive maneuvers and overall combat proficiency, as lighter sets enable enhanced agility and fluidity of movement, facilitating easier and longer dodges compared to heavier sets. Bandit Set is a Light Armor Set, so you will experience fast Dodge with no Stamina cost penalty.

Leto Mark I is an Ultra Heavy Armor Set, and will Flop instead of Dodge with a 75% penalty on Stamina cost.

Head.descricao: I sed to wear a field cap and sunglasses combo like this during field operations. It's a practical and comfortable headwear that helps reduce glare and keeps the sun out of your eyes.

Although much of the knowledge of the ancient Pan has been lost to time, it is known they had their own form of magic. The lodestones are thought to be part of this, allowing them to create artifacts that reacted to each other's presence in unique and sometimes powerful ways.

Those we dubbed `pilots` were little more than tools--minds serving as interfaces. The Astropaths determined N'Erud's course, and the Custodian ensured the ship arrived safely. Pilots were merely delegates for our collective will.

That the One True King suffered the young prince to live despite his attempted coup is a curious thing. Either the king thought exile a punishment graver than death...or his mercy bespoke that which he dared not otherwise admit.

Radiant Set is a Heavy Armor Set, so you will experience Slow Dodge with a 50% penalty on Stamina cost. However, 9 points in the Strong Back trait is enough to wear this set with just medium encumbrance.

Head.descricao: A makeshift accessory that may not offer any protection to the head, but they do serve a vital function of shielding the eyes. With the harsh conditions of the wasteland and the debris flying around, it's crucial to keep your vision clear and safe.

The Red King's true name, you ask? Who's to say he was ever granted one? He was both to inherit a title, after all, and inherit it, he did! Of course, were he in possession of a true name, I would most certainly know it.

A hat that once belonged to some kind of man in black. Or did it? Mudtooth went through some kind of crazy experience to get this thing, though the details are a bit muddled. Either that, or he found it in a dumpster. You're going to choose to believe it's the former.

The weight of this crown is heavy, so much heavier than you might have guessed. Though aged, the shining metal has been carefully preserved, and the crown jewel radiates with a passionate fury you can scarcely comprehend.

Lovingly crafted by a skilled hatter who clearly takes great pride in their work. After being exposed to endless days of rain, the shell began to separate from the crown, so a woven cord was tied around the center to hold it in place-for now.
